meanings.definition: The action or process of secreting a substance.
meanings.sent1: The incretions of hormones play a vital role in regulating body functions.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study incretions to understand how our bodies produce essential chemicals.
meanings.sent3: The incretions of sweat during a workout can be quite noticeable!
meanings.sent4: Her incretions of creativity flowed freely as she painted the masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The incretions of tears expressed her deep emotions.

meanings.definition: A substance secreted by a gland or cell.
meanings.sent1: The incretions released by the pancreas help in digestion.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are researching the incretions produced by certain cells.
meanings.sent3: The incretions of saliva are essential for breaking down food.
meanings.sent4: His incretions of kindness touched everyone around him.
meanings.sent5: The incretions of nectar attracted the bees to the flowers.

meanings.definition: The accumulation of a substance in a bodily organ or tissue.
meanings.sent1: The incretions of fat in the body can lead to health issues.
meanings.sent2: Doctors monitor the incretions of calcium in the bones.
meanings.sent3: The incretions of dust on the bookshelf made it look neglected.
meanings.sent4: His incretions of knowledge filled his mind with wisdom.
meanings.sent5: The incretions of water in the soil helped the plants grow.
